title: Kutch Desert Wildlife Sanctuary
short_description: Located in the Great Rann of Kutch, famous for the 'Flamingo City' where thousands of flamingos breed.
long_description: Kutch Desert Wildlife Sanctuary is situated in the Great Rann of Kutch, Gujarat, India. It was declared a sanctuary in February 1986. It is one of the largest protected areas in the country with an area of about 7505.22 km2. The sanctuary supports a wide variety of water birds and mammalian wildlife. The area is famous for its 'Flamingo City', located in the mudflats of the Rann, which is the only known breeding ground for Greater Flamingos in the entire region. The sanctuary also contains the fossil park at Khadir Bet.
wildlife_significance: Only known breeding ground of Greater Flamingos in India (Flamingo City).
major_experiences: Visit Dholavira (Harappan site) inside the sanctuary
guides_and_tips: It's a border area (Indo-Pak); BSF permissions may be needed for certain deep areas. Winters are best.
how_to_reach: By Air: Bhuj (100 km). By Road: Drive to Khavda or Rapar.
permits_and_fees: Permit for Rann of Kutch required (online).
conservation_notes: Salt extraction activities are regulated near breeding grounds.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive Bhuj. Drive to Dholavira crossing the Rann. Visit Excavation site. Day 2: Visit Fossil Park. Drive on the Rann road. Spot flamingos. Return to Bhuj.
safety_tips: Do not drive off-road on the salt flats; vehicles can get stuck in mud. mirages are common.

operating_season.season_notes: Rann fills with water in monsoon; visual appeal changes.
